1. I noticed that the people with the best chance of getting into elite colleges are those with legacy in the college. This trend is shown throughout with the top 0.1% being 7x more likely to get in than someone with comparing attributes but no legacy.

2. I wonder why the legacy of a applicant is so important and impactful when accepting people even when someone may be better yet without legacy.

3. THis relates to my community because many people in my community are about to go to college and if this is a determining factor in admissions, this could cause some problems regarding college acceptance.
4. "The world of legacy, you are who you're born to." what getting in to college is really like now days.
ace_sentences: I noticed a trend about admissions to elite colleges.
A legacy applicant is an applicant who has a legacy in a college.
People with a legacy in a college have a better chance of getting into this college.
This trend exists in the top 0.1% of applicants.
An applicant in the top 0.1% is 7 times more likely to get in than a comparable applicant without a legacy.
I wonder why the legacy of an applicant is important in admissions.
I wonder why the legacy of an applicant is impactful in admissions.
A non-legacy applicant may be better than a legacy applicant.
However, a non-legacy applicant may be rejected.
This issue relates to my community.
Many people in my community will apply to colleges soon.
Legacy status can be a determining factor in admissions.
If legacy status is a determining factor in admissions, then some people in my community could have problems with college acceptance.
The headline is: The world of legacy: you are who you are born to.
The headline is also: What getting into college is really like nowadays.
